ldc-AFF-Index-eo.def: Defined as the percentage share of the agriculture, hunting, forestry, and fishing sectors in the gross value added of a country
ldc-AFF-Index-eo.name: Share of agriculture, fisheries and forestry in GDP
ldc-AFF-Index-eo.source: United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA).

ldc-AFF-Value-eo.def: Defined as the percentage share of the agriculture, hunting, forestry, and fishing sectors in the gross value added of a country
ldc-AFF-Value-eo.name: Share of agriculture, fisheries and forestry in GDP
ldc-AFF-Value-eo.source: United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA).

ldc-AIN-Index-eo.def: Defined as the standard deviation of the difference between agricultural production and its 20-year trend
ldc-AIN-Index-eo.name: Agricultural instability
ldc-AIN-Index-eo.source: CDP Secretariat, based on agricultural production data from FAO, FAOSTAT

ldc-AIN-Value-eo.def: Defined as the standard deviation of the difference between agricultural production and its 20-year trend
ldc-AIN-Value-eo.name: Agricultural instability
ldc-AIN-Value-eo.source: CDP Secretariat, based on agricultural production data from FAO, FAOSTAT

ldc-DRY-Index-eo.def: Defined as the percentage of population that lives in drylands, defined by long term averages of the ratio of precipitation to potential evapotranspiration (known as aridity index)
ldc-DRY-Index-eo.name: Population living in drylands
ldc-DRY-Index-eo.source: CDP Secretariat, based on an aridity index derived from high resolution climate data from University of East Anglia Climatic Research Unit (CRU TS version 4) and gridded population data from Center for International Earth Science Information Network - CIESIN - Columbia University

ldc-DRY-Value-eo.def: Defined as the percentage of population that lives in drylands, defined by long term averages of the ratio of precipitation to potential evapotranspiration (known as aridity index)
ldc-DRY-Value-eo.name: Population living in drylands
ldc-DRY-Value-eo.source: CDP Secretariat, based on an aridity index derived from high resolution climate data from University of East Anglia Climatic Research Unit (CRU TS version 4) and gridded population data from Center for International Earth Science Information Network - CIESIN - Columbia University

ldc-LECZ-Index-eo.def: Population below 5m is the percentage of the total population living in areas where the elevation is 5 meters or less.
ldc-LECZ-Index-eo.name: Share of population living in low elevated coastal zones
ldc-LECZ-Index-eo.source: Center for International Earth Science Information Network - CIESIN - Columbia University and CUNY Institute for Demographic Research (CIDR), City University of New York. 2020. Low Elevation Coastal Zone (LECZ) Urban-Rural Population and Land Area Estimates, Version 3 Preliminary Release. Palisades, NY: NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC). Accessed 30 July 2020. For a number of small island and coastal States, data are from CIESIN, Population, Landscape, And Climate Estimates, Version 3 (PLACE III)

ldc-LECZ-Value-eo.def: Population below 5m is the percentage of the total population living in areas where the elevation is 5 meters or less.
ldc-LECZ-Value-eo.name: Share of population living in low elevated coastal zones
ldc-LECZ-Value-eo.source: Center for International Earth Science Information Network - CIESIN - Columbia University and CUNY Institute for Demographic Research (CIDR), City University of New York. 2020. Low Elevation Coastal Zone (LECZ) Urban-Rural Population and Land Area Estimates, Version 3 Preliminary Release. Palisades, NY: NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC). Accessed 30 July 2020. For a number of small island and coastal States, data are from CIESIN, Population, Landscape, And Climate Estimates, Version 3 (PLACE III)

ldc-REM-Index-eo.def: Defined as a trade-weighted average of a country's distance from world markets
ldc-REM-Index-eo.name: Remoteness and landlockedness
ldc-REM-Index-eo.source: CDP Secretariat, based on data for exports and imports and goods and services from United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA) and distance data from Centre d'Etudes Prospectives et d'Informations Internationales

ldc-REM-Value-eo.def: Defined as a trade-weighted average of a country's distance from world markets
ldc-REM-Value-eo.name: Remoteness and landlockedness
ldc-REM-Value-eo.source: CDP Secretariat, based on data for exports and imports and goods and services from United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA) and distance data from Centre d'Etudes Prospectives et d'Informations Internationales

ldc-VIC-Index-eo.def: Measures the share of population who are victims of disasters, defined as people killed or affected (i.e. requiring immediate food, water, shelter, sanitation, or medical assistance)
ldc-VIC-Index-eo.name: Victims of disasters
ldc-VIC-Index-eo.source: CDP Secretariat, based on disaster data from the OFDA/CRED International Disaster Database and population data from United Nations Population Division, World Population Prospects (WPP) 2019 Revision

ldc-VIC-Value-eo.def: Measures the share of population who are victims of disasters, defined as people killed or affected (i.e. requiring immediate food, water, shelter, sanitation, or medical assistance)
ldc-VIC-Value-eo.name: Victims of disasters
ldc-VIC-Value-eo.source: CDP Secretariat, based on disaster data from the OFDA/CRED International Disaster Database and population data from United Nations Population Division, World Population Prospects (WPP) 2019 Revision

ldc-XCON-Index-eo.def: Provides information on the exposure to trade shocks resulting from a concentrated export structure. Measures the product concentration of a country's exports
ldc-XCON-Index-eo.name: Export concentration
ldc-XCON-Index-eo.source: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)

ldc-XCON-Value-eo.def: Provides information on the exposure to trade shocks resulting from a concentrated export structure. Measures the product concentration of a country's exports
ldc-XCON-Value-eo.name: Export concentration
ldc-XCON-Value-eo.source: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)

ldc-XIN-Index-eo.def: The standard deivation of the difference between the value of annual export earnings and its 20-year trend
ldc-XIN-Index-eo.name: Export instability
ldc-XIN-Index-eo.source: CDP Secretariat, based on data for exports and imports and goods and services and trade dependency (ratio of exports plus imports to GDP) from United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA)

ldc-XIN-Value-eo.def: The standard deivation of the difference between the value of annual export earnings and its 20-year trend
ldc-XIN-Value-eo.name: Export instability
ldc-XIN-Value-eo.source: CDP Secretariat, based on data for exports and imports and goods and services and trade dependency (ratio of exports plus imports to GDP) from United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA)
